title: The meaning of deterministic for torch._C._cudnn_batch_norm_forward
body_html:
I try to use torch._C._cudnn_batch_norm_forward.
The prototype is as following in source code.

at::Tensor cudnn_convolution_full_forward(
    const at::Tensor& input, const at::Tensor& weight, const at::Tensor& bias,
    IntList padding, IntList stride, IntList dilation,
    int64_t groups, bool benchmark, bool deterministic);

What's the meaning of the "bool deterministic"?
body_text:
I try to use torch._C._cudnn_batch_norm_forward.
The prototype is as following in source code.
at::Tensor cudnn_convolution_full_forward(
    const at::Tensor& input, const at::Tensor& weight, const at::Tensor& bias,
    IntList padding, IntList stride, IntList dilation,
    int64_t groups, bool benchmark, bool deterministic);

What's the meaning of the "bool deterministic"?
body:
I try to use **torch._C._cudnn_batch_norm_forward**.
The prototype is as following in source code.
```
at::Tensor cudnn_convolution_full_forward(
    const at::Tensor& input, const at::Tensor& weight, const at::Tensor& bias,
    IntList padding, IntList stride, IntList dilation,
    int64_t groups, bool benchmark, bool deterministic);
```
What's the meaning of the **"bool deterministic"**?
